exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

category

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

description

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

general_knowledge_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
subcategories_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

category

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

General_Knowledge.utils module

General_Knowledge.utils.category_objects(request, category_name)[source]

Retrieve the category queryset from the database based on its category name.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object containing information about the client’s request.

  • category_name (str) – The user’s selected category

Returns:

The 10 random question objects selected from the database

Return type:

question_selection or None

General_Knowledge.utils.get_category_names(response)[source]

Retrieve the desired category names from the Open Trivia DB json response.

Parameters:

response (dict) – The json response containing all categories available on Open Trivia DB.

Returns:

Return the list of selected subcategories for the category according to the ids.

Return type:

list

General_Knowledge.utils.get_json_categories()[source]

Return the json response for the available categories on Open Trivia DB.

Returns:

The json response

Return type:

dict or None

General_Knowledge.utils.get_next_question_id(category_name, question_id, question_selection_pks)[source]

Find the question id for the next question in the quiz.

Parameters:

  • category_name (str) – The name of the subcategory the user selected on the category homepage.

  • question_id (int) – The primary key for the current question object

  • question_selection_pks (list) – The list of 10 random primary keys chosen for the quiz session

Returns:

Return the primary key of the next question object, should there be another in the list

Return type:

int or None

General_Knowledge.utils.get_specific_json_category(quantity: int, category: int)[source]

Return the json response for a specific Open Trivia DB quiz category

Parameters:

  • quantity (int) – Enter the number of questions the API should return

  • category (int) – Enter the id for the desired quiz category

Returns:

The json response

Return type:

dict or None

General_Knowledge.utils.mix_choices(choices: list)[source]

Mix the choices for each question in a quiz

Parameters:

choices (list) – The choices are a list of 4 options.

Returns:

Return the shuffled choices

Return type:

list

General_Knowledge.views.detail(request, category_name, question_id)[source]

A view that displays the quiz question.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object containing information about the client’s request.

  • category_name (str) – The name of the category the user selected on the category homepage.

  • question_id (int) – The pk of the question object

Returns:

Return the gen_detail template.

Return type:

HttpResponse

General_Knowledge.views.selection(request, category_name, question_id)[source]

A a selection view that handles the submission of form data, goes to the next question and redirects to the results view. Otherwise the form will be redisplayed.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object containing information about the client’s request.

  • category_name (str) – The name of the category the user selected on the category homepage.

  • question_id (int) – The pk of the question object the user has submitted

Returns:

Return the gen_detail or the gen_result template.

Return type:

HttpResponse

General_Knowledge.views.try_new_quiz(request)[source]

A view that clears the session data and redirects to the homepage of the category.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object containing information about the client’s request.

Returns:

Return the gen_quiz template

Return type:

HttpResponse
